result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or the Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 104 days.
Concurrent with: Counts 4 and 5

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and/or from prison wages.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school. (35 hours a week) within 60 days of release on extended supervision.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
No contact with Victim A.
Not to use or possess of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Follow all rules and orders of courts with competent jurisdiction.
Operate a MV with a valid driver's license only.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and DNA are paid as a Condition of Probation in Count 1.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court costs and DNA are to be paid as a Condition of Probation in Count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1 but consecutive to Count 4
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Transcript received and filed for the following date and court event: April 28, 2022 - Plea and Sentencing. Transcribed by: Rose Marie Roderick.

Sent to DOC on 9-12-22.
Filed by Atty. Perri

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua M Smith
Current: P.O. Box 661, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 05-13-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Acknowledgement of Transport to: Dodge Correctional Institution, filed by the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

04:15 PM Defendant Joshua M Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy Christian Perri.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1, 4 and 5.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 6 are dismissed and read in.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 104 Days) CONCURRENT with Counts 4 and 5
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	No contact with Victim A.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Random U.A.s;
-	No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Follow all rules and orders of courts with competent jurisdiction;
-	Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within 60 days of release on extended supervision;
-	Operate a Motor Vehicle only with a Valid Drivers License;

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  



Count 4:
60 Days Jail.  CONCURRENT with Count 1

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.



Count 5:
6 Months Jail.  CONCURRENT with Count 1 but CONSECUTIVE to Count 4.

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant to comply with I.D.  Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key victim B can have contact in his official capacity.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.    Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A or her children, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.
